name: getMarkdownPageInfo

simplifiedSchema.fullComment:
A different way to represent a path array in a nested object of folders

{  "folderName": {    "file1": null,    "file2": null  },  "folderName2": {    "file1": null,    "file2": null  } }
for markdown-reader-ui, the pages can be markdown files, but they can also be connected to models

schema.fullComment: path to be used as the url. no preceding slash

if given, the md-file will be provided to the frontend

project relative path
if true, this item will be shown in the menu

description: If a markdown page is found, this function fetches all metadata needed to render that markdown page

returnType.rawType: Promise<{ markdownFile: import("/Users/king/King/operations/tools/types/code-types/build/WebMarkdownFile").WebMarkdownFile | null; nextQueryPath: string | null; previousQueryPath: string | null; projectRelativeMarkdownPath: string | null; }>
